# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$ModuleInfo = Import-Module -Name Pester -PassThru
$ModuleInfo
```

# Expected behavior

```
# Should not through error
$ModuleInfo = Import-Module -Name Pester -PassThru

```

# Actual behavior

```
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> $ModuleInfo = Import-Module -Name Pester -PassThru
Add-Type : Cannot add type. Definition of new types is not supported in this language mode.
At C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Pester\3.4.0\Functions\SetupTeardown.ps1:301 char:1
+ & $SafeCommands['Add-Type'] -TypeDefinition @'
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : PermissionDenied: (:) [Add-Type], PSNotSupportedException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CannotDefineNewType,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.AddTypeCommand

PS C:\WINDOWS\system32>

PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> $ModuleInfo

ModuleType Version    Name                                ExportedCommands
---------- -------    ----                                ----------------
Script     3.4.0      Pester                              {AfterAll, AfterEach, Assert-MockCalled, Assert-Verifiable...
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32>

```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.17763.316
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}

```

comments.author: HumanEquivalentUnit
comments.body:
> Expected behavior
> Should not through error

The error is caused by code in the Pester module trying to do something which constrained mode does not allow. To have no error, the [Pester module]( https://github.com/pester/Pester) would need to be changed so it will work in constrained mode.

title: Import-module throughts error but actually imports in constrained mode
